au.com.agic.apptesting.steps

Class MouseEventStepDefinitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.agic.apptesting.steps.MouseEventStepDefinitions

  • public class MouseEventStepDefinitions
extends java.lang.Object
    Gherkin steps for sending javascript events to elements. These steps have Atom snipptets that start with the prefix "mouse". See https://github.com/mcasperson/iridium-snippets for more details.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MouseEventStepDefinitions()

      void mouseEventHiddenElementStep(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String selector, java.lang.String alias, java.lang.String selectorValue, java.lang.String exists)
      Some applications use mouse events instead of clicks, and PhantomJS will often need us to supply these events manually.
      void mouseEventSimpleHiddenElementStep(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String alias, java.lang.String selectorValue, java.lang.String exists)
      Some applications use mouse events instead of clicks, and PhantomJS will often need us to supply these events manually.

      • MouseEventStepDefinitions

        public MouseEventStepDefinitions()

    • Method Detail

      • mouseEventSimpleHiddenElementStep

        @When(value="^I(?: dispatch a)? ?\"(mouse.*?)\"(?: event)? on (?:a|an|the) hidden element found by( alias)? \"([^\"]*)\"( if it exists)?$")
public void mouseEventSimpleHiddenElementStep(java.lang.String event,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.String exists)
                                                                                                                                                                                   throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                                                                                                                                                                          java.lang.InterruptedException
        Some applications use mouse events instead of clicks, and PhantomJS will often need us to supply these events manually. This step uses simple selection.
        Parameters:
        event - The mouse event we want to generate (mousedown, mouseup etc)
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        exists - If this text is set, an error that would be thrown because the element was not found is ignored. Essentially setting this text makes this an optional statement.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • mouseEventHiddenElementStep

        @When(value="^I(?: dispatch a)? ?\"(mouse.*?)\"(?: event)? on (?:a|an|the) hidden element with (?:a|an|the) (ID|class|xpath|name|css selector)( alias)? of \"([^\"]*)\"( if it exists)?$")
public void mouseEventHiddenElementStep(java.lang.String event,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String selector,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String alias,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String selectorValue,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String exists)
        Some applications use mouse events instead of clicks, and PhantomJS will often need us to supply these events manually.
        Parameters:
        event - The mouse event we want to generate (mousedown, mouseup etc)
        selector - Either ID, class, xpath, name or css selector
        alias - If this word is found in the step, it means the selectorValue is found from the data set.
        selectorValue - The value used in conjunction with the selector to match the element. If alias was set, this value is found from the data set. Otherwise it is a literal value.
        exists - If this text is set, an error that would be thrown because the element was not found is ignored. Essentially setting this text makes this an optional statement.
